bibl.title: Greek Papyri of the Classics Department at Stanford (P. Stan. Class.). Part I.
bibl.seg: Willy Clarysse & Christelle Fischer-Bovet, Greek Papyri of the Classics Department at Stanford (P. Stan. Class.). Part I.

The Greek Papyri from the Department of Classics at the University of Stanford (California) contain 61 numbers. The texts (all from cartonnage) date from the second half of the third and from the second century BC. The place of origin is clearly the Fayum. - 1. P. Stan. Class. Inv. 2. Contract of a loan involving a boat. Krokodilon Polis, 19 June 193 BC. - 2. Inv. 6. Receipt to the shepherds of Mouchis. Mouchis, 19 July 215 BC. - 3. Inv. 29. Receipt to the shepherds of Mouchis. Mouchis, 26 January 215 BC. - 4. Inv. 16. Receipt to shepherds. Krokodilon Polis, 203/2, 179/8, or 168/7 BC (?). - 5. Inv. 9 + 34 recto. Draft of a public sale. Krokodilon Polis, 234/3 BC. - 6. Inv. 27. Public sale. Arsinoite nome (?), 205/4, 188/7, or 164/3 BC.
